description: Build the documentation website for Tap at tap.sh using VitePress with a striking landing page and comprehensive docs, inspired by Linear's clean aesthetic.

userStories.title: Initialize VitePress project
userStories.description: As a developer, I need VitePress initialized in /docs so we have a foundation for the documentation site.
acceptanceCriteria: VitePress is installed as a dev dependency
docs/.vitepress/config.ts exists with basic site metadata (title: 'Tap', description: 'Presentations for developers')
docs/index.md exists as placeholder landing page
npm run docs:dev script works and serves the site
npm run docs:build script works and builds to docs/.vitepress/dist

userStories.title: Configure navigation and sidebar
userStories.description: As a user, I need proper navigation so I can browse the documentation structure.
acceptanceCriteria: Top nav includes: Getting Started, Guide, Reference, Examples, GitHub link
Sidebar for /guide/ section includes: Writing Slides, Layouts, Themes, Animations & Transitions, Code Blocks, Live Code Execution, Presenter Mode, Images & Media, Building & Export
Sidebar for /reference/ section includes: CLI Commands, Frontmatter Options, Slide Directives, Layouts Reference, Drivers, Keyboard Shortcuts
Sidebar for /examples/ section exists (can be empty for now)
Navigation works when clicking between sections

acceptanceCriteria: docs/getting-started.md exists with title and placeholder content

userStories.title: Set up custom theme with Linear-inspired base styling

acceptanceCriteria: docs/.vitepress/theme/index.ts exists and extends default theme

Background colors configured for light mode (#ffffff, #f8fafc)
Dark mode colors configured (#0f172a bg, #f8fafc text)
